CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection dismissed (Article 35-1 - Exhaustion of domestic remedies);Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Criminal proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time);Violation of Article 13+6 - Right to an effective remedy (Article 13 - Effective remedy) (Article 6 - Right to a fair trial;Criminal proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time);Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed (Article 41 - Pecuniary damage;Just satisfaction);Non-pecuniary damage - claim dismissed (Article 41 - Non-pecuniary damage;Just satisfaction)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and now lives in GPE . He owns CARDINAL per cent of the shares in ORG ( hereafter the “ JDE ” ) , a company registered in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of ORG of GPE conducted a customs check of the coffee - tilling goods supplied by ORG ( the company owned by the applicant ) as a contributory to the statutory fund of the jointstock company , ORG . The customs check showed that a cargo - customs declaration had been made by the representatives of ORG on the basis of false documents . On DATE ORG initiated a criminal investigation into alleged smuggling and fraud offences .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the case was transferred to the prosecution service of LOC ( hereafter “ the prosecution ” ) for further investigation . On the basis of resolutions of the prosecution of DATE , DATE and DATE , ORG seized documents pertaining to the financial and commercial activities of ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecution seized the goods supplied to the statutory fund of ORG as evidence and on DATE it froze ORG ’s accounts . It also seized all of the company ’s documentation , including accounting books and copies of contracts , as well as other property belonging to the company and the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was detained on suspicion of having committed a criminal offence under LAW of GPE ( the “ ORG ” ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecution ordered the applicant ’s detention on remand in view of the pending criminal investigation against him .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecution charged the applicant with smuggling ( Article CARDINAL of the ORG ) , financial fraud ( Article CARDINAL - CARDINAL ORG ) and fraud committed by an official ( Article CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) ORG ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor extended the deadline for the investigation by DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor extended the applicant ’s detention on remand by DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor extended the deadline for investigation by DATE and DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was additionally charged with tax evasion ( Article CARDINAL - CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) ORG ) and deliberate use of a forged document ( Article CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) ORG ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was notified about the completion of the investigation .
CARDINAL . On DATE the deputy prosecutor approved the bill of indictment issued by the investigating officer .
CARDINAL . On DATE the case file was transferred to the NORP ORG of PERSON ( the “ ORG ” ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the prosecution sought the annulment of the remittal decision before ORG ( the “ ORG ” ) on the ground that there was already sufficient corroborating evidence .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the prosecution ’s application , considering that it was necessary to undertake additional investigations in order to reconstruct the crime .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was released from detention on the basis of the resolution of the prosecution ’s investigator . The applicant was required not to leave his place of residence .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s recognisance not to abscond was changed to an undertaking to appear before the investigating authorities and the court . On the same date , the criminal investigation against the applicant was suspended due to the issue of a search warrant against Ms Lodyanova ( a suspect in the case ) .
CARDINAL . In DATE ORG instituted proceedings in ORG against ORG of GPE , ORG and the prosecution , seeking the return of its property and documents .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , by a letter addressed to ORG , stated that it would not consider the complaints directed against the legal entities as it had no jurisdiction over them .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , following ORG ’s additional submissions , refused to consider the complaints against ORG of GPE and the prosecution service , on the ground that the complaints were outside its jurisdiction . It also held that the ORG arbitration courts had jurisdiction in the matter .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed ORG ’s cassation appeal , quashed the ruling of DATE and remitted the case for reconsideration by the same court .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG suspended the proceedings in the case due to ORG ’s failure to comply with the formal requirements of LAW for the introduction of the complaints ( LAW of the Code ) . The court gave ORG until DATE to rectify the mistakes .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused to consider ORG ’s claims because of its failure to comply with the ruling of CARDINAL DATE . On DATE ORG upheld this decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG lodged further complaints against ORG GPE , ORG and ORG of LOC .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG left ORG ’s complaints without consideration on account of its failure to comply with the formal requirements of LAW of LAW for the introduction of complaints . ORG was given until DATE to rectify the mistakes .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused to consider ORG ’s complaints due to its failure to comply with the ruling of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the ruling of CARDINAL DATE and remitted the case for consideration on the merits to the same court .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected ORG ’s motion concerning compensation for moral and material damage caused to ORG by ORG of GPE , ORG and ORG GPE . In particular , it found that ORG ’s complaints amounted to a separate claim , which had to be lodged with the court in compliance with LAW .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , in the course of a hearing in the presence of the parties , refused to consider ORG ’s claims for the return of property and documents as being outside the ORG jurisdiction , in accordance with Articles CARDINAL - CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the Code of Civil Procedure and Article CARDINAL of the Code of Criminal Procedure . It also decided to terminate the proceedings in the case .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld this decision . In particular , it stated that , for the time - being , ORG ’s claims could not be determined in civil proceedings . It also noted that a different procedure for their consideration existed in the domestic law .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant instituted proceedings in ORG against the prosecution , demanding termination of the criminal investigation against him . On DATE ORG rejected his claims as being outside the court ’s jurisdiction under LAW of LAW . In particular , it specified that the applicant had not availed himself of a special procedure for lodging complaints against acts of the investigator carried out in the course of the pre - trial investigation .
CARDINAL . On DATE the criminal investigation was terminated on account of lack of corroborating evidence .

CARDINAL . On DATE the deputy prosecutor quashed the resolution of DATE due to the investigating officer ’s failure to comply with ORG instructions of DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . The prosecution remitted the case for additional investigations .
CARDINAL . NORP On DATE ORG passed a resolution authorising the apprehension of PERSON .
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecution informed the applicant that the criminal charges against him were still being investigated .
CARDINAL . The criminal investigation is currently suspended due to the nation - wide search for PERSON .
“ Human and ORG rights and freedoms are protected by the court .
Everyone is guaranteed the right to challenge in court the decisions , actions or omission of bodies exercising ORG power , local self - government bodies , officials and officers .

... After exhausting all domestic legal remedies , everyone has the right of appeal for the protection of his or her rights and freedoms to the relevant international judicial institutions or to the relevant bodies of international organisations of which GPE is a member or participant .
Everyone has the right to protect his or her rights and freedoms from violations and illegal encroachments by any means not prohibited by law . ”
“ The Prosecution of Ukraine constitutes a unified system that is entrusted with :
CARDINAL . NORP prosecuting in court on behalf of the State ;
CARDINAL . NORP representing the interests of a citizen or of the State in court in cases determined by law ;
CARDINAL . supervising compliance with the laws of the bodies which conduct detective and search activities , inquiries and pre - trial investigations ;

CARDINAL . supervising the observance of the laws in the execution of judicial decisions in criminal cases , and also in the application of other coercive measures aimed at the restraint of ORG personal liberty . ”

“ The Prosecution of Ukraine is headed by ORG , who is appointed to office with the consent of PERSON of GPE , and dismissed from office by the President of GPE . PERSON of GPE may express no confidence in ORG , which results in his or her resignation from office .
The term of authority of ORG is DATE . ”
“ The organisation and operational procedure for the bodies of the Prosecution of GPE shall be established by the law . ”
“ ORG in GPE is administered exclusively by the courts .
... The jurisdiction of the courts extends to all legal relations that arise in the ORG .
... Judicial decisions are adopted by the courts in the name of GPE and are mandatory for execution throughout the entire territory of GPE . ”

“ The pre - trial investigation in criminal cases shall last no longer than DATE . This term shall commence from the moment the criminal proceedings were initiated up to the point of their being sent to the prosecutor with :

an indictment or a resolution concerning the committal of the case to the court in order to decide on applicable measures of compulsory medical treatment or terminating the proceedings in the criminal case . In the event of impossibility to terminate the proceedings this term shall be extended by DATE by the district , city , military prosecutor of the army , fleet , military districts ( commands ) , garrisons and the prosecutors of equal rank . The time it takes for the accused and his representatives to familiarise themselves with the materials in the criminal case - file shall not be included in the calculation of the period of the pre - trial investigation .

In especially complicated cases the term of the pre - trial investigation , established by part CARDINAL of this Article , can be extended on the basis of the reasoned resolution of the investigator DATE , to be approved by the prosecutor of GPE , prosecutors of regions , the prosecutor of GPE , the military prosecutor of the military district ( command ) , fleet and the prosecutors of equal rank or their deputies .
Further continuation of the term of the pre - trial investigation shall only be approved by ORG or by his deputies .

Where the case was remitted for an additional investigation , or if the terminated case was re - opened , the term of additional investigation shall be established by the prosecutor who supervises the investigation , and shall not be DATE from the moment of the re - initiation of the proceedings in the case . Further continuation of this term shall be enacted on a general basis .

The rules enshrined in this Article , shall not be applicable to criminal proceedings where it has not been established who committed the crime . The running of the term of the investigation in such cases shall commence from the date of identifying the person who committed a crime . ”

( On DATE ORG interpreted this provision and held that the maximum deadline for investigating criminal cases can not be fixed . It decided that the time allowed for investigation should be reasonable , and referred to LAW . )
“ ... Complaints in respect of the acts of the investigating officer can be lodged with the court .

The complaints in respect of the actions of the investigating officer shall be considered by the first instance court in the course of the preliminary hearing in the case or in the course of its consideration on the merits , unless otherwise provided by this Code ... ”
( This provision was declared partly unconstitutional by ORG on DATE ) .

“ Complaints in respect of the prosecutor ’s actions during the conduct of the pre - trial investigation or other individual investigative actions in the case shall be submitted to the superior prosecutor , who shall consider them in accordance with the procedure and within the terms prescribed by Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL of this Code .
A complaint about the prosecutor ’s actions can be lodged with the court .

Complaints about the prosecutor ’s actions shall be considered by the first - instance court in the course of the preliminary consideration of the case or in the course of its consideration on the merits , unless otherwise provided for by this LAW . ”
“ The claim shall be lodged with the court in writing .
The claim shall contain the following :
CARDINAL . the full name of the court the claim is lodged with ;

CARDINAL . NORP the exact name of the applicant and respondent , their place of residence and their situation , as well as the name of the representative of the applicant , in the event the claim is lodged by the representative ;
CARDINAL . the content of the claim ;
CARDINAL . the circumstances with which the applicant substantiates his claim ;
CARDINAL . NORP reference to relevant evidence substantiating the claim ;
CARDINAL . reference to the sum claimed ;
CARDINAL . the signature of the applicant and his representative , mentioning the date the claim was lodged .

... Written evidence shall be appended to the claim and , in the event the claim is lodged by the representative of the applicant , a letter of authority or another document certifying the powers of the representative . ”
“ The proceedings in the case shall be terminated by the court :
CARDINAL . NORP if the claims are outside the courts’ jurisdiction ; ... ”
“ The following complaints are outside the courts’ jurisdiction : ...

- ... the actions or acts of an official of a body of inquiry , preliminary investigation , prosecution or court with regard to which a non - judicial procedure for considering complaints is established .... ”

( This provision was declared partly unconstitutional as to the complaints “ against the actions or acts of an official of a body of inquiry , preliminary investigation , prosecution ... ” by the decision of ORG . CARDINAL of DATE ) .

“ To declare Article MONEY § CARDINAL of the Code of Civil Procedure as not in compliance with LAW ( unconstitutional ) , concerning the lack of jurisdiction of the courts as regards – ... the actions or acts of an official of a body of inquiry , preliminary investigation , prosecution or court with regard to which a non - judicial procedure for considering complaints has been established ... ”
“ To declare that the following provisions do not contravene LAW ( are constitutional ) :

... CARDINAL . Part CARDINAL of Article CARDINAL , part CARDINAL of Article CARDINAL , in accordance with which the complaints against the resolutions of the investigator or prosecutor concerning the arraignment of the accused shall be considered by the first instance court in the course of the administrative hearing or in the course of the consideration of the case on the merits .

CARDINAL . To declare the following not to correspond to LAW ( unconstitutional ) : the provisions of part CARDINAL of Article CARDINAL , part CARDINAL of Article CARDINAL of the Code of Criminal Procedure of GPE , that prevent the consideration of complaints against the investigator or prosecutor at the stage of the preliminary investigation concerning the basis , grounds and the procedure for the initiation of criminal proceedings against a particular person . ”
